p: Other viruses that are capable of establishing a placental infection include parvoviruses. Vertical transmission of parvoviruses can be explained by parvovirus B19 receptor expression by placental trophoblasts and erythroid precursor cells [ 82]. B19 infection during pregnancy can result in complications such as spontaneous abortion and intrauterine fetal death, and Pasquinelli et al. has demonstrated that placental endothelial cells can also be infected with parvovirus B19 [ 83, 84].
